TopicTitle: Easiest way to make parts? (And some other questions)

Articles.Content:
Hello bois and babes! I really want to make parts, and i think i found a really easy way to do it!

Step 1: grab the UbioWelding mod and weld something.

Step 2: Mess around with the config of the part you welded.

Step 3: Well done have fun lol.

Is this a legit way to make parts? Can i just publish something like this? And how do i make a resource?

9 hours ago, NSEP said:

Is this a legit way to make parts?

I have no idea. But it appears to work for you...?

 

9 hours ago, NSEP said:

Can i just publish something like this?

Yes, with caveats. You can declare in your license only the things as 'yours' which you did yourself - in other words, only the creation of the config file in this case. It's a perfectly valid thing to release a parts mod that contains only config files that make use of stock assets, but since every mod advertised on these forums needs to have a license, you need to be careful when picking said license to not make claims of owning anything that's not actually yours. Explicitly crediting Squad always helps remove ambiguity.

Also, if you welded modded parts into your new part, then the mod(s) that ship the component(s) become a hard dependency.

 

9 hours ago, NSEP said:

And how do i make a resource?

All stock resources are configured in a simple config file, much like parts are, and adding a new resource is as simple as writing such a config yourself. Try looking up the stock resources; I believe the file is called ResourcesGeneric.cfg (if not, it definitely has the word "resources" somewhere in it though). You can simply copy&paste a resource declaration into your own file and just change all the parameters to your liking.

However, do give the Community Resource Pack a look. It contains definitions for a huge variety of resources, with largely sensible values for densities, costs and pumping behavior.

 

Edited August 15, 2016 by Streetwind

Yes, with caveats. You can declare in your license only the things as 'yours' which you did yourself - in other words, only the creation of the config file in this case. It's a perfectly valid thing to release a parts mod that contains only config files that make use of stock assets, but since every mod advertised on these forums needs to have a license, you need to be careful when picking said license to not make claims of owning anything that's not actually yours. Explicitly crediting Squad always helps remove ambiguity.

Also, if you welded modded parts into your new part, then the mod(s) that ship the component(s) become a hard dependency.

 

All stock resources are configured in a simple config file, much like parts are, and adding a new resource is as simple as writing such a config yourself. Try looking up the stock resources; I believe the file is called ResourcesGeneric.cfg (if not, it definitely has the word "resources" somewhere in it though). You can simply copy&paste a resource declaration into your own file and just change all the parameters to your liking.

However, do give the Community Resource Pack a look. It contains definitions for a huge variety of resources, with largely sensible values for densities, costs and pumping behavior.

 

Thanks boi. I have alot of ideas for mods.

1 hour ago, NSEP said:

Thanks boi.

Ouch.

Very inappropriate, FYI. Regardless of intent.

Edited August 15, 2016 by Streetwind

15 hours ago, NSEP said:

Is this a legit way to make parts? Can i just publish something like this? And how do i make a resource

It's a fairly legit way to make parts for your own use, you will run into some issues using parts from other already released mods and before considering release you should as a FIRST step contact whoever made the original parts and see if they are happy with you releasing a butchered version of the part.

6 hours ago, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

FIRST step contact whoever made the original parts and see if they are happy with you releasing a butchered version of the part.

I'd agree with this even if the license permits it's the neighborly thing to do if you are welding and redistributing assets from a mod that is in active development or maintence.
